synthlab.api
Interface Scheduler

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicScheduler
public interface Scheduler

This class is at the core of the synthesizer. It is responsible of asking to the modules of a module pool to do their computation, and to propagate the results from output ports to input ports. Once created, you can attach a scheduler to a module pool using setPool().

Field Summary
static int SamplingBufferSize
          This is the amount of samples that this scheduler will ask the port to use.

Field Detail

SamplingBufferSize

static final int SamplingBufferSize
This is the amount of samples that this scheduler will ask the port to use. The default sampling rate is 44100 (CD quality), so using a sampling buffer size of 441 means that we will work with small buffers of 10ms. If you computer cannot handle the amount of propagation that it generates, try increasing this value under the following conditions: - be aware that the more this value is increased, the slower the reaction time will be when changing port values (responsiveness) - always keep this value an integer multiple of the sampling rate (44100) or results are undefined.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getPool

ModulePool getPool()
This will retrieve the pool this scheduler is currently bound to, or null if no module pool was previsouly bound.

Returns:

getTasks

java.util.List<Module> getTasks()

play

void play(int count)
This will start the scheduler. The playing will be done in an other thread so this call is not blocking. You can provide a maximum number of propagations before the play stops, or just provide 0 for an infinite play(). If the scheduler was not set to a valid module pool, the results are undefined.

reorder

void reorder()

setPool

void setPool(ModulePool pool)
This will bind this scheduler to the provided module pool.

stop

void stop()
This will effectively stop the scheduler. The playing thread will stop.
